title: Technical Experiences
description: Under my given pseudonym I have built a brand over the past ten(+) years of; publishing programming projects publicly, sharing technical tips, and contributing to FOSS organizations.

sections.heading: 3D Printing
sections.description: Documentation and Blender 3D plugin source code for interacting with networked 3D printers and file exporting

sections.heading: Adaptive iptables
sections.description: Linux iptables automation that seamlessly integrates with SystemD for real-time adaptation of firewall rules based on the state of services, ensuring optimal security and performance.

sections.heading: Address Storage
sections.description: Implemented a smart contract using Solidity map data structures, enabling efficient storage and interaction with key/value address pairs.

sections.heading: Algorithms and Data Structures
sections.description: Publishing a collection of extensive example algorithms, and data structures, written in Go and TypeScript programming languages; to aid developers learning either.

sections.heading: Arti
sections.description: Contributed to an implementation of Tor written in Rust, by addressing linter warnings, implementing CI/CD automation through Git Hooks, and enhancing the Wiki documentation for improved accessibility and usability.

sections.heading: Bored Box Batch Sender
sections.description: Developed a powerful tool for efficiently sending `ERC721` and/or `ERC1155` tokens to multiple recipients. Utilized advanced blockchain technologies and smart contracts to streamline the process, resulting in faster and more cost-effective transactions.

sections.heading: Bored Box Extras
sections.description: Designed and implemented an optimized `ERC721` token contract, enabling multi-recipient minting functionality. Utilized Solidity and Polygon blockchain technology to ensure secure and efficient transactions.

sections.heading: Bored Box NFT
sections.description: Developed an optimized, and partially upgradable, `ERC721` Solidity smart contract for the Ethereum blockchain.

sections.heading: Configure Vim
sections.description: Improved productivity and efficiency by customizing and configuring Vim, a powerful text editor, to suit personal preferences and workflow.  Implemented keybindings, plugins, and themes to enhance coding experience and streamline development processes.

sections.heading: Curriculum Vitae
sections.description: Public CV with CI/CD magics to generate and publish PDF automatically to GitHub Pages whenever source content changes

sections.heading: Execution Permissions
sections.description: Developed and deployed a free to use Solidity contract that enables fine-grained control over function execution permissions.

sections.heading: Feed JSON
sections.description: Created a JSON feed generator, Feed JSON, using Jekyll collection and Liquid layout to extract data from FrontMatter and generate a dynamic JSON feed.

sections.heading: Hybrid Iterator
sections.description: Developed a Python 2/3 compatible iterator that combines the functionality of a dictionary and an iterator.

sections.heading: Inject JavaScript
sections.description: Utilized tools such as PyPDF2 to seamlessly inject JavaScript code into the body of PDF documents; allowing for dynamic and interactive functionality within PDFs, enhancing user experience and enabling advanced data manipulation.

sections.heading: Install Linux on USB
sections.description: Published a comprehensive guide that provides detailed instructions on how to install Linux to a USB drive with UEFI boot capabilities. Utilized Virtual Box and other select technologies to ensure a seamless installation process.

sections.heading: Iterate Text
sections.description: Developed a robust Rust library that provides a collection of helper functions and structures for efficient iteration over text and files.

sections.heading: Iterator Cascade Callbacks
sections.description: JavaScript/TypeScript library providing Rust-like ergonomics for working with iterables. Implemented powerful methods such as `.filter` and `.map` to streamline data manipulation and transformation processes.

sections.heading: Jekyll Admin
sections.description: Culminates a combination of Git, Jekyll, and other relevant technologies to streamline repository management, facilitate collaboration, and simplify the process of publishing websites.

sections.heading: Opentensor -- Docs
sections.description: Revamped and maintained a comprehensive documentation resource for configuring Subtensor network nodes and interacting with customized Substrate blockchain. Collaborated with a team to fix formatting issues, update broken links, and rectified Bash scripting errors, resulting in improved user experience and accessibility.

sections.heading: Python First Library
sections.description: Developed and published a comprehensive step-by-step guide with source code, to assist Python developers in seamlessly publishing their packages to PyPi.

sections.heading: Python Graph Theory
sections.description: Developed an extensive open-source repository demonstrating a range of graph algorithms and techniques. Leveraged core Python features, without relying on third-party libraries, to provide valuable insights for researchers and aspiring software developers.

sections.heading: SASS Build
sections.description: Published a project that is utilized by over two-hundred projects to leverage the power of GitHub Actions, and CSS transpiler technology, to streamline the CI/CD process for developers.

sections.heading: Shellchecker
sections.description: Developed a convenient shebang wrapper that executes a script only if the `shellcheck` tool does not detect any errors.

sections.heading: Subtensor
sections.description: Improved the performance and stability of a Blockchain built on the Substrate node template. Leveraged a wide range of tools and technologies to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance, including (but not limited to) `shellcheck`, GitHub Actions, Git Hooks, and code coverage reporting.

sections.heading: Toxic Cookies
sections.description: Developed a JavaScript/TypeScript tool specifically designed for Quality Assurance developers and ethical penetration testers. This tool allows users to poison browser cookies of the currently loaded domain, providing valuable insights into potential security vulnerabilities.

sections.heading: Trap Failure
sections.description: Improved error handling and debugging process by creating a Bash script that provides advanced formatting and inspection capabilities for trapped errors. Utilized various shell builtins, and string manipulation techniques, to enhance error reporting, including custom stack trace error messages, and error code identification.

sections.heading: Tweet Archive to MarkDown
sections.description: Authored Rust library for parsing Twitter archive ZIP files to convert Tweets into MarkDown files with FrontMatter for use within static site generators such as Jekyll

sections.heading: Validate Mint Signature
sections.description: Developed and implemented a Solidity smart contract to ensure the authenticity and secure transmission of off-chain signed authentication. Utilized advanced cryptographic techniques, EVM assembly, and algorithms to verify signatures, preventing potential mempool theft.

sections.heading: Vendor Prefixes
sections.description: Developed and implemented a comprehensive set of SCSS mixins for CSS vendor prefixes; which streamline the process of writing cross-browser compatible CSS code, resulting in improved browser compatibility and reduced development time.

sections.heading: View ERC721
sections.description: A free smart contract that efficiently batches up-to three-thousand off-chain calls for on-chain data into a single request; resulting in performance improvements and reduced network overhead.
